name: SaaS Subscription
description: Recurring-access software or data platform with tiered pricing.
idealConditions: Low marginal cost per additional user
challenges: Slow early revenue growth while MRR builds
Support and reliability expectations are high

riskSignals.technical: Requires stable uptime and support processes
riskSignals.market: Needs focused segment with clear adoption trigger
riskSignals.financial: Revenue ramps gradually; CAC and churn critical
riskSignals.execution: Smooth onboarding, documentation, and retention loops

phase1: Define ICP (ideal customer profile) and buyer persona
Prototype core feature set; recruit 5–10 pilot users
phase2: Launch public beta with onboarding flows
Collect usage telemetry; ship iterative improvements
Refine pricing; add annual plan and discounts
phase3: Publish case studies; add upsell/expansion features
Focus on retention and LTV/CAC optimization

name: Licensing
description: Grant rights to use your IP to manufacturers/integrators for fees/royalties.
idealConditions: Protectable IP (patentable or strong trade secrets)
Partners exist with manufacturing or route-to-market
Desire to avoid heavy capex and operations
challenges: Revenue depends on licensee execution speed
revenueCharacteristics: Upfront fees, milestone payments, royalties (% of sales)

unitEconomics.scaling_behavior: high operating leverage; low marginal cost

riskSignals.technical: Evidence that IP is novel and defensible
riskSignals.financial: Lag between signing and royalty inflows
riskSignals.execution: Need standard license templates and audit clauses

phase1: File provisional patent; prepare tech brief & demo
Draft template license with counsel (territory, field of use)
phase3: Convert provisional to PCT; pursue priority markets
Expand to additional licensees; track performance
Invest in IP enforcement and brand association

name: Reseller / Distributor Channel
description: Use existing distributors to sell your product into established markets.
idealConditions: Target customers reached via existing channels
You can train and support channel partners
challenges: Less direct access to customer feedback
Must maintain enablement materials and SLAs

unitEconomics.revenue_unit: per unit or per contract via channel

riskSignals.technical: Product is stable and supportable by third parties
riskSignals.market: Channel has reach into your ICP
riskSignals.execution: Partner training, collateral, and incentives ready

phase1: Create partner playbook (pitch, demo, pricing, FAQs)
Run 2–3 joint demos to real prospects
phase2: Sign first 1–2 partners; agree on targets and incentives
Train their sales teams; set support SLAs
phase3: Expand territorial coverage; add tiered incentives
Introduce partner certification to maintain quality

name: Pay-Per-Use (Service / IoT / Access)
description: Customers pay when they consume usage (e.g., kWh, hours, API calls).
idealConditions: Customers value flexibility and low upfront costs

unitEconomics.revenue_unit: per usage unit (e.g., kWh / hour / API call)
unitEconomics.scaling_behavior: capex heavy initially; stabilizes with utilization

riskSignals.execution: Customer onboarding, billing, and support processes

phase1: Deploy 1–2 pilot sites with reliable metering
Validate billing logic and customer acceptance
Define minimum usage commitments where needed
phase2: Roll out to 5–10 customers; refine pricing per segment
phase3: Scale via anchor clients and channel partners
Optimize utilization; introduce tiered usage bundles
Integrate with finance for asset-backed expansion

name: Consulting-to-Product Ladder
description: Start with paid services to learn and de-risk, then convert recurring patterns into a product.
idealConditions: Early uncertainty; need revenue while learning
Strong domain expertise and client access
Clear path to codify recurring problems into product
challenges: Time management between delivery and productization
Requires discipline to standardize and say no
revenueCharacteristics: Service fees initially; product or subscription later

riskSignals.market: Repeated client pain points across segments
riskSignals.financial: Bridge cashflow from services to product build

phase1: Close 2–3 service clients aligned to target product
Prototype reusable modules behind the scenes
phase2: Launch alpha product to existing clients
Bundle services + product to prove ROI
Collect case studies and refine features
phase3: Public product launch; shift sales motion
Scale via referrals and partner channels
